EmoteActions.Message: Making Masks is kind of a waste of time, since Alexander can do it as well.  I can make wondrous thrown weapons though.
Scarecrow heads have an odd magic this time of year.  If you carve them just right, and perform a little chant... Ah HA!  Success...
Mosswart head, eh? Okay Let me just umm. Yeah. I need the paint. Okay there we go and a little more green and there we go.
It's not that hard... really.

A banderling head, great. Okay so I need to stick this on something. Do you have a stick? Oh never mind I'll just put it on my other hand. Sure and with a twist of the knife here and there. Ow! No, no it's nothing.
There you go. No the bleeding will stop soon don't worry about me.
Interesting. I must say that I am glad to finally be doing something more than second--hand work. Wait a minute! This is something that Alexander didn't want to work with. Perfect! Just perfect!
%n grumbles under his breath. As he grumbles he begins to make changes to the mask.
There! That's the best work I have in me.
Alexander's Apprentice leans over his small work bench and attempts to muffle the sound of his work as much as possible.
As he hands the newly fashioned Sunstone Gauntlets back to you, he quickly brushes the gemstone chips out the nearby window.
Now I know these aren't the highest quality alterations, but I'm learning. Promise me you won't go to Alexander if they fall apart on you in combat.

Hi, I'm Calvin, Alexander's apprentice.  He only lets me practice on skulls and scarecrow heads but he has also allowed me to start work on mosswart and banderling heads, using his old designs. So if you give one of them to me, I'll make something out of it.
Making masks is kind of a waste of time.  I can turn skulls and scarecrow heads into deadly throwing weapons, however.  Just don't tell my master!

Alexander doesn't know it yet, but I am working on a side project that I hope will pad my pockets a bit better once I get better at it. Give me your Sunstone Gauntlets and I'll see about bringing out a nice orange color in them!
